wikipedia_page.main: Sir William Allan Jamieson PRCPE LLD (1839–1916) was a Scottish physician and academic author. He served as President of the Royal College of Physicians of Edinburgh 1908 to 1910 being succeeded by Sir Byrom Bramwell.

response: * Sir William Allan Jamieson (1839–1916) surgeon and medical author, President of the Royal College of Physicians of Edinburgh 1908–1910
|data-sort-value="William Allan Jamieson"|William Allan Jamieson President of the Royal College of Physicians of Edinburgh lived and died at 35
* William Allan Jamieson, (1839–1916) Scottish physician and academic author
* William Allan Jamieson (1839–1916), Scottish physician and academic author
He succeeded William Allan Jamieson as President of the Royal College of Physicians of Edinburgh in 1910. He was knighted by King George V in 1924.

response: | William Allan JamiesonCraig, W. S. History of the Royal College of Physicians of Edinburgh, p.1076

In 1905 he became President to the Edinburgh Harveian Society. In 1906, he succeeded Dr John Playfair as President of the Royal College of Physicians of Edinburgh in 1906. Underfill died in office on 24 April 1908. John Playfair completed Underhill's term in office before being succeeded by William Allan Jamieson.
